alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 12:28PM EDT until July 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Housatonic River At Gaylordsville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The water reaches businesses on the low side of Spring Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest at 9.2 feet. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 04/03/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Housatonic River Gaylordsville Flood Stage: 8.0 Observed Stage at Tue 12 pm: 9.2 Forecast: Tue 2 pm 9.2 Tue 8 pm 9.0 Wed 2 am 8.7 Wed 8 am 8.4 Wed 2 pm 8.2 Wed 8 pm 8.0 Thu 2 am 7.7 Thu 8 am 7.4 Thu 2 pm 7.2 Thu 8 pm 6.9 Fri 2 am 6.7 Fri 8 am 6.5 &&
